_header: In May when thy heart is light
Note: For secular poems having similar first line, see 2539 and 2540.
Subjects: prayers; complaints, lovers’; May, songs of
_description: Advice urging men to pray to God instead of their lovers in May — three monorhyming lines

HunHM139.Transcription:
In may qhen that thy hert ys lyȝtEuer make thy praer to god
                    almyȝtAnd then heuen for the shall be byȝt
HunHM139.Note:
Added to mostly blank column by a hand of the sixteenth century,
                    signed(?) John Wyldon.
